title: How to Make Kool Aid Popcorn

steps.headline: Make the popcorn.
steps.description: Pop the popcorn kernels using a pot on a stovetop, or in a microwave. For more tips on popping popcorn, read wikiHow's instructions for making popcorn. If you're using a microwave, consider reading about how to microwave popcorn.

steps.headline: Prepare the baking dish.
steps.description: Line a baking tray with parchment paper or a silicone baking sheet. If the baking dish is non-stick, you could rely on that, but note that the Kool-Aid will probably make the surface sticky and harder to stir/remove the popcorn pieces, as well as clean the dish.

steps.headline: Spread the popcorn across the prepared baking dish.
steps.description: Using a wooden spoon, spread the popcorn on the baking dish. Try to avoid heaping the popcorn, instead aiming for a neat and flat single layer. If you find the dish isn't large enough, use two dishes.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 225º Fahrenheit or 110º Celsius.
Heat the sugar, syrup, and butter.
steps.description: In a small pot, place the sugar, syrup and butter into a saucepan. Heat to boiling and boil for three minutes until the liquid bubbles. Remove the pot from the stovetop and set aside for about 10 minutes. This forms the sugar syrup. Keep an eye on this while the syrup boils and stir if needed. Do not let it boil for too long, as it can easily burn.

steps.headline: Prepare the Kool-Aid.
steps.description: Add the two packages of Kool-Aid in a medium mixing bowl. Pour the baking soda and mix thoroughly using a spoon.

steps.headline: Pour the sugar syrup into the bowl.
steps.description: Slowly pour the sugar syrup into the Kool-Aid mixture. Stir with a wooden spoon to combine completely.

steps.headline: Add the syrup over the popcorn.
steps.description: Using a fork, drizzle the Kool-Aid colored sugar syrup evenly over the spread-out popcorn. Mix the popcorn around with the wooden spoon to coat the popcorn pieces completely with the syrup, turning each piece a new color.

steps.headline: Bake the popcorn.
steps.description: Place the baking dish filled with colored popcorn into the preheated oven. Bake for 10 minutes, then remove and stir. Hold the dish with oven mitts each time, and have a heatproof surface to set the dish down onto.

steps.headline: Return for another 10 minutes, then remove and stir.
steps.description: Repeat this remove-and-stir process two more times for another 10 minutes of baking, stirring, then baking. In all, this will take about 40 minutes of baking time.

steps.headline: Have the popcorn cool.
steps.description: Remove the colored popcorn from the oven. Allow to cool. Sit the baking dish over a wire cooling rack to provide sufficient aeration for cooling.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Break up for serving. When it is cool enough to handle, pull apart any pieces stuck together. It is now ready for serving. Tip into a suitable large bowl and serve. Enjoy!

Pour the sugar syrup into the bowl. Slowly pour the sugar syrup into the Kool-Aid mixture. Stir with a wooden spoon to combine completely. Making the Kool-Aid Popcorn Add the syrup over the popcorn. Mix the popcorn around with the wooden spoon to coat the popcorn pieces completely with the syrup, turning each piece a new color. Bake the popcorn.
